title: Don't get your hopes up for Fallout 76 on Nintendo Switch, say Bethesda | Trusted Reviews
description:
![fallout
76](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Bethesda have thrown themselves into supporting the Nintendo Switch, releasing
ports for [The Elder Scrolls V:
Skyrim](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/the-elder-scrolls-v-skyrim-
special-edition), [Doom](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/doom) and
[Wolfenstein
II](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/wolfenstein-2-nintendo-switch) for
the hybrid machine. However, despite Fallout 76 coming to the Xbox One, PS4
and PC, Bethesda have said it “wasn’t doable” to bring the upcoming
multiplayer Fallout to Ninty’s flagship.

The news came during a panel at PAX Aus, reported by
[Gamespot](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fallout-76-for-nintendo-switch-
wasnt-doable-but-be/1100-6462843/), where Bethesda marketing executive Pete
Hines claimed a Switch version wasn’t possible, although Bethesda had
initially considered it.

During the panel, Hines claimed Nintendo’s handheld “is part of every
conversation with dev we have now about what we’re doing going forward because
we consider it to be a viable platform.”

**Related:[Best Gaming Mouse](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-gaming-
mouse-3515423)**

Regarding the company’s push towards the Switch, Hines said: “I enjoy us being
seen as the third-party leader in terms of supporting Switch. People go, ‘Hey,
you’ve got a lot more stuff [on Switch] than this publisher or that
publisher.’ That’s what I want Bethesda to be known as. We’re guys who will
take some risks.”

While their status as the third-party leader for Switch support is very much
unconfirmed at this point, the fact the studio is thinking fondly of the
handheld is exciting to hear about for Nintendo Switch owners. The studio’s
next Wolfenstein title is planned for the Nintendo Switch, and while Fallout
76 isn’t coming, this isn’t a bad omen for Switch support in general. Bethesda
are still flying the flag.  
  
[Fallout 76](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/fallout-76) releases on
November 14th.
